Analytical Chemistry.name: Beer-Lambert Law
Analytical Chemistry.description: Relates absorbance to concentration in UV-Vis spectroscopy.

Analytical Chemistry.name: Transmittance
Analytical Chemistry.description: Fraction of light passing through a sample.

Analytical Chemistry.name: Relationship Between Absorbance and Transmittance
Analytical Chemistry.description: Connects absorbance and transmittance in spectrophotometry.

Analytical Chemistry.name: pH Calculation
Analytical Chemistry.description: Determines acidity of a solution.

Analytical Chemistry.name: pOH Calculation
Analytical Chemistry.description: Determines basicity of a solution.

Analytical Chemistry.name: Relationship Between pH and pOH
Analytical Chemistry.description: At 25°C, sum of pH and pOH in aqueous solution is 14.

Analytical Chemistry.name: Henderson-Hasselbalch Equation
Analytical Chemistry.description: Calculates pH of buffer solutions.

Analytical Chemistry.name: Electrochemical Cell Potential
Analytical Chemistry.description: Potential difference generated by a galvanic cell.

Analytical Chemistry.name: Nernst Equation
Analytical Chemistry.description: Calculates cell potential under non-standard conditions.

Analytical Chemistry.name: Faraday’s Law of Electrolysis
Analytical Chemistry.description: Relates mass of substance deposited to electric charge.

Analytical Chemistry.name: Titration Calculation
Analytical Chemistry.description: Determines concentration in acid-base titrations.

Analytical Chemistry.name: Percent Composition

variables.mass of component: Mass of the specific component in the mixture

Analytical Chemistry.description: Calculates the percentage of a specific component in a mixture by mass.

Analytical Chemistry.name: Mole Fraction

variables.n_i: Number of moles of component i

Analytical Chemistry.description: Ratio of moles of a component to total moles.

Analytical Chemistry.name: Molarity
Analytical Chemistry.description: Concentration expressed in moles per liter.

Analytical Chemistry.name: Molality
Analytical Chemistry.description: Concentration expressed per kg of solvent.

Analytical Chemistry.name: Weight Percent
Analytical Chemistry.description: Fraction of solute by mass in solution.

Analytical Chemistry.name: Specific Conductivity
Analytical Chemistry.description: Measures ionic conduction in solution.

Analytical Chemistry.name: Molar Conductivity
Analytical Chemistry.description: Conductivity per mole of electrolyte.

Analytical Chemistry.name: Partition Coefficient
Analytical Chemistry.description: Distribution of solute between two immiscible phases.

Analytical Chemistry.name: Chromatographic Retention Factor
Analytical Chemistry.description: Measures interaction of analyte with stationary phase.

Analytical Chemistry.name: Chromatographic Resolution
Analytical Chemistry.description: Separability of two chromatographic peaks.

Analytical Chemistry.name: Gravimetric Analysis Mass Calculation
Analytical Chemistry.description: Determines analyte mass from precipitate.

Analytical Chemistry.name: Rate Law for First-Order Reaction
Analytical Chemistry.description: Concentration decreases exponentially in first-order kinetics.

Analytical Chemistry.name: Integrated First-Order Rate Law
Analytical Chemistry.description: Predicts concentration over time for first-order reactions.

Analytical Chemistry.name: Second-Order Reaction Rate Law
Analytical Chemistry.description: Rate proportional to square of concentration.

Analytical Chemistry.name: Integrated Second-Order Rate Law
Analytical Chemistry.description: Time-dependence of concentration in second-order reactions.

Analytical Chemistry.name: Limit of Detection
Analytical Chemistry.description: Smallest quantity of analyte detectable.

Analytical Chemistry.name: Limit of Quantification
Analytical Chemistry.description: Smallest quantity of analyte quantifiable with confidence.

Analytical Chemistry.name: Sample Mean

variables.n: Number of observations in the sample

Analytical Chemistry.description: The arithmetic average of a set of sample observations, widely used to estimate the central tendency of a population.

Analytical Chemistry.name: Arithmetic Mean
Analytical Chemistry.description: Sum of all observations divided by the number of observations. The most common type of mean.

Analytical Chemistry.name: Weighted Mean
Analytical Chemistry.description: Mean calculated when different observations have different levels of importance or frequency.

Analytical Chemistry.name: Geometric Mean
Analytical Chemistry.description: The nth root of the product of n values. Useful for growth rates, ratios, and percentages.

Analytical Chemistry.name: Harmonic Mean
Analytical Chemistry.description: Reciprocal of the arithmetic mean of the reciprocals. Used for rates or ratios like speed or efficiency.

Analytical Chemistry.name: Quadratic (Root Mean Square) Mean
Analytical Chemistry.description: Square root of the mean of squares. Useful in physics and engineering for average magnitudes of varying quantities.

Analytical Chemistry.name: Two-Point Linear Interpolation

variables.x: Independent variable at which value is to be interpolated

Analytical Chemistry.description: Estimates the value of a function at a given point x using two known points (x0, y0) and (x1, y1). Assumes a linear relationship between the points.
